definitions: flat ceramic or stone piece used to cover floors, walls, or roofs
small decorative square or pattern used in artistic designs
rectangular graphical element in a computer interface that displays information
examples: The bathroom floor was covered with white ceramic tiles
Workers installed clay tiles on the Mediterranean-style roof
The mosaic featured thousands of tiny colored tiles
Ancient Roman tiles decorated the museum's collection
She arranged the app tiles on her smartphone home screen
The dashboard displayed data in customizable tiles

definitions: the act or process of covering a surface with tiles
the collective arrangement or pattern of tiles on a surface
examples: The tiling of the kitchen backsplash took two days
Professional tiling requires careful measurement and planning
The geometric tiling created an intricate visual pattern
Victorian tiling often featured elaborate floral designs

definitions: drawer or compartment in a cash register for storing money
unstratified glacial sediment deposited directly by ice
the time or point up to which something continues
examples: The cashier counted the money in the till at closing time
Someone had stolen fifty dollars from the shop till
Geologists studied the till deposits left by ancient glaciers
The till contained rocks transported hundreds of miles
They worked from dawn till dusk every day
Wait till tomorrow before making your decision

definitions: the preparation of land for growing crops by plowing and cultivation
land that has been prepared or is suitable for cultivation
examples: Conservation tillage helps prevent soil erosion on farms
Spring tillage prepares the fields for planting season
The farm had two hundred acres of prime tillage
Rich tillage in the valley supported abundant crops

definitions: lever used to turn a boat's rudder for steering
machine or tool used for breaking up soil in preparation for planting
lateral shoot growing from the base of a grass or cereal plant
examples: He gripped the tiller firmly as waves rocked the sailboat
The wooden tiller connected directly to the rudder
The rotary tiller churned through the compacted garden soil
Farmers used horse-drawn tillers before mechanization
Wheat plants produced multiple tillers from each seed
Extra tillers increased the grain yield per plant

definitions: the process of preparing land for cultivation by breaking up the soil
examples: Spring tilling aerates the soil for better root growth
No-till farming reduces the need for traditional tilling

definitions: a sloping position or angle away from vertical or horizontal
a medieval jousting contest or modern competitive encounter
a particular bias, tendency, or philosophical inclination
examples: The tower had developed a dangerous tilt over centuries
She adjusted the tilt of her computer monitor
Knights prepared for the tilt in the tournament field
The debate became a verbal tilt between opposing views
The article had a conservative tilt in its analysis
His political tilt influenced his interpretation of events

definitions: wood prepared for use in building and carpentry
trees suitable for use as building material while still growing
traditional warning cry when a tree is about to fall
examples: The cabin was built from locally harvested timber
Oak timber framed the historic barn structure
The forest contained valuable timber worth millions
Sustainable timber management preserves forest ecosystems
The lumberjack yelled timber as the pine tree fell
Everyone scattered when they heard someone shout timber

definitions: land covered with forest suitable or managed for timber production
examples: The company owned thousands of acres of timberland
Investment in timberland provides long-term returns

definitions: the altitude or latitude beyond which trees cannot grow due to environmental conditions
examples: Hikers camped just below the timberline on the mountain
The timberline varies with latitude and local climate

definitions: the distinctive quality or character of a musical sound apart from its pitch and intensity
examples: The violin's timbre differed noticeably from the viola's
Each singer had a unique vocal timbre

definitions: the indefinite continued progress of existence and events
a particular point or moment in hours and minutes
a period or interval between two events or during which something exists
an instance or occasion of something happening
the rhythmic pattern or tempo in music
examples: Time moves forward regardless of our wishes
Scientists study the nature of space and time
What time does the meeting start tomorrow
The clock showed the time as quarter past three
She lived in Paris for a long time
Recovery time varies between different patients
This is the third time you've been late
Remember that time we got lost hiking
The band struggled to keep time during the performance
Dance movements must match the musical time

definitions: person who records or monitors time in sports events or workplace
device such as a clock or watch used for measuring time
examples: The timekeeper stopped the clock during the injury timeout
Factory timekeepers tracked workers' hours for payroll
This Swiss timekeeper has maintained accuracy for decades
Ancient sundials served as primitive timekeepers

definitions: the activity or process of measuring and recording time
system or method for tracking work hours or scheduling
examples: Precise timekeeping is essential for GPS navigation
The evolution of timekeeping changed human civilization
The company implemented new timekeeping software for employees
Manual timekeeping was replaced by digital systems

definitions: graphical representation of events in chronological order
schedule showing the planned timing of project tasks or milestones
examples: The museum's timeline showed major events in human history
She created a timeline of the company's development
The project timeline indicated completion by next quarter
Marketing timeline included all campaign launch dates

definitions: device that measures or controls time intervals automatically
examples: Set the kitchen timer for twenty minutes
The bomb timer counted down to zero

definitions: printed or digital schedule showing planned times for events or transportation
examples: The train timetable showed hourly departures to London
Students received their exam timetable at registration

definitions: the choice or control of when something should be done or happen
the coordinated sequence of mechanical operations in an engine
examples: Perfect timing is crucial for successful comedy
The timing of the announcement surprised everyone
The engine timing needed adjustment for better performance
Valve timing affects fuel efficiency significantly

definitions: large bowl-shaped drums played in orchestras with pedals for tuning
examples: The timpani roll announced the symphony's dramatic climax
Four timpani were positioned behind the orchestra

definitions: soft silvery-white metallic element used in alloys and coatings
metal container typically used for storing food or other items
thin layer of tin applied to another metal for protection
examples: Tin is combined with copper to make bronze
The periodic table shows tin as element fifty
She opened a tin of biscuits for tea
Paint tins lined the garage shelves
The tin coating prevented the steel from rusting
Food cans have tin plating on the inside

definitions: medicinal solution of a substance dissolved in alcohol
a slight trace or suggestion of a quality or characteristic
examples: The herbalist prepared a tincture of echinacea
Iodine tincture disinfected the wound
There was a tincture of sadness in her smile
His speech carried a tincture of irony

definitions: dry, flammable material used for lighting fires from a spark
examples: Dry leaves and bark served as tinder for the campfire
The drought turned the forest floor into tinder

definitions: a pointed projection on a fork, rake, or similar implement
examples: The pitchfork had four sharp tines
One tine broke off the antique silver fork

definitions: a slight degree of color or shade added to something
a small amount of a quality or feeling
examples: The sunset gave the clouds a pink tinge
Autumn leaves showed a tinge of yellow
Her voice carried a tinge of regret
There was a tinge of bitterness in the coffee

definitions: a slight stinging or prickling sensation in the body
examples: She felt a tingle run down her spine
The cold made his fingers tingle

definitions: a continuous slight stinging or prickling physical sensation
examples: The tingling in her arm worried her
Excitement caused a pleasant tingling sensation

definitions: person who travels mending household utensils and implements
someone who makes small adjustments or experiments with something
examples: The village tinker fixed pots and sharpened knives
Irish tinkers traveled in colorful wagons
He was a tinker who loved fixing old radios
Weekend tinkers gathered in the garage workshop

definitions: thin strips of shiny metal or plastic used as decoration
examples: Silver tinsel draped across the Christmas tree branches
The stage was decorated with gold tinsel

definitions: a shade or variety of color created by adding white
artificial color applied to hair or other materials
examples: The artist mixed various tints of blue
Window tint reduced the glare significantly
She chose a auburn tint for her hair
The salon offered dozens of hair tints

definitions: the pointed or rounded end or extremity of something
money given for service in addition to the official payment
useful piece of advice or inside information
place where rubbish is left or dumped
examples: The tip of the pencil broke during writing
Snow covered the mountain tips
She left a generous tip for excellent service
The standard tip is fifteen to twenty percent
Thanks for the tip about the new restaurant
Police received an anonymous tip about the robbery
They took old furniture to the local tip
The illegal tip polluted the nearby stream

definitions: truck or trailer that can tilt to unload its contents
person who gives gratuities or provides information
examples: The tipper truck delivered gravel to the construction site
Hydraulic tippers emptied their loads quickly
Restaurant staff appreciated the generous tipper
The police tipper remained anonymous

definitions: a long angry speech expressing strong criticism or accusation
examples: The coach launched into a tirade about poor performance
Her tirade against corruption lasted twenty minutes

definitions: rubber covering inflated with air placed around a wheel rim
state of physical or mental exhaustion
examples: The car needed four new tires before winter
Bicycle tires require regular pressure checks
Marathon runners often hit the tire at mile twenty
Mental tire affected her concentration

definitions: group of cells forming the structural materials of organisms
soft thin paper used for wiping or cleaning
light thin fabric or woven material
examples: Muscle tissue repairs itself after exercise
The biopsy revealed healthy tissue
She grabbed a tissue to wipe her tears
Facial tissues filled the bathroom cabinet
The dress was made of delicate gold tissue
Light filtered through the tissue curtains

definitions: small songbird of the family Paridae with a short bill
examples: Blue tits visited the garden bird feeder daily
Great tits nested in the old oak tree

definitions: person of exceptional importance, ability, or achievement in a field
member of a family of giants in Greek mythology
examples: He was a titan of the technology industry
Business titans gathered at the economic summit
The titans fought against Zeus in ancient mythology
Prometheus was a titan who gave fire to humans

definitions: strong lightweight silvery-white metallic element used in alloys
examples: Titanium implants are biocompatible with human tissue
Aircraft use titanium for its strength-to-weight ratio

definitions: one tenth of annual produce or earnings given to support clergy or church
examples: Medieval farmers paid tithes to the local church
Many congregations still practice tithing today

definitions: name of a book, composition, or other artistic work
legal document proving ownership of property or assets
position of being the champion in a sport or competition
examples: The book's title perfectly captured its theme
She couldn't remember the title of the movie
The title deed proved ownership of the land
They held clear title to the property
The boxer defended his heavyweight title successfully
She won the title three years running

definitions: tailless amphibian with dry warty skin that typically lives on land
examples: A large toad sat motionless in the garden
Common toads return to ponds for breeding

definitions: sliced bread browned by exposure to heat
ritual of drinking together in honor of someone or something
person who is celebrated or highly regarded
examples: She spread butter on her morning toast
The smell of burnt toast filled the kitchen
Everyone raised glasses for a toast to the bride
He proposed a toast to their success
She was the toast of Broadway after her performance
The young scientist became the toast of the conference

definitions: electrical appliance for toasting slices of bread
examples: The new toaster had settings for different browning levels
Smoke triggered the alarm when the toaster jammed

definitions: the process of browning bread or other food with heat
the act of drinking in honor of someone or something
examples: Toasting the spices enhanced their flavor
The smell of toasting bread woke everyone
Wedding toasting continued late into the evening
Traditional toasting rituals vary across cultures

definitions: prepared leaves of nicotine-containing plants used for smoking or chewing
examples: Tobacco cultivation dominated the colonial economy
The shop sold various tobacco products

definitions: long flat-bottomed sled curved up at the front for sliding downhill on snow
examples: Children rode the toboggan down the snowy hill
Traditional toboggans were made from curved wood

definitions: a young child who is just beginning to walk, typically between one and three years old
examples: The toddler took unsteady steps across the room
Toddler tantrums are a normal developmental phase

definitions: drink made of alcoholic liquor with hot water, sugar, and spices
examples: He sipped a hot toddy to ward off the cold
The bartender prepared rum toddies for the guests

definitions: any of the five digits at the end of the human foot
the front part or tip of a shoe or sock
examples: She stubbed her toe on the table leg
Ballet dancers dance on their toes
The steel toe protected his foot from injury
Her socks had holes in the toes

definitions: hard chewy candy made from boiled sugar or molasses with butter
examples: English toffee covered with chocolate was her favorite
The toffee stuck to his teeth

definitions: soft white food made from pressed soybean curds, high in protein
examples: Marinated tofu absorbed the flavors perfectly
Silken tofu works well in smoothies
